example[0]: I need the money. And besides, when I agree to do something, I do it.
explanation[0]: In written English, people do not usually use besides as a sentence adverb. They start a sentence with the more formal moreover instead:
example[1]: Moreover, smoking is linked with heart disease and strokes.
definition[1]: in addition to someone or something else that you are mentioning
example[2]: The area has stunning scenery, beautiful beaches, and much more besides.
example[3]: People choose jobs for other reasons besides money.
example[4]: Besides myself, the only English people there were Keith and Doreen.
example[5]: Besides being heartbroken, she felt foolish.
